members.name: $include-ie
members.doc: True to include Internet Explorer specific rules for IE9 and lower. IE10 and up are considered to be "modern" browsers, and as such do not need any of the CSS hacks required for IE9 and below. Setting this property to false will result in a significantly smaller CSS file size, and may also result in a slight performance improvement, because the browser will have fewer rules to process.
members.short_doc: True to include Internet Explorer specific rules for IE9 and lower. ...

members.name: $include-missing-images
members.doc: True to include files which are not found when compiling your SASS
members.short_doc: True to include files which are not found when compiling your SASS ...

members.name: $include-opera
members.doc: True to include Opera specific rules
members.short_doc: True to include Opera specific rules ...

members.name: $include-rtl
members.doc: True to include right-to-left style rules. This variable gets set to true automatically for rtl builds. You should not need to ever assign a value to this variable, however it can be used to suppress rtl-specific rules when they are not needed. For example: @if $include-rtl { .x-rtl.foo { margin-left: $margin-right; margin-right: $margin-left; } }
members.short_doc: True to include right-to-left style rules. ...

members.name: $include-safari
members.doc: True to include Safari specific rules
members.short_doc: True to include Safari specific rules ...

members.name: $include-slicer-border-radius
members.doc: True to include rules for rounded corners produced by the slicer. Enables emulation of CSS3 border-radius in browsers that do not support it.
members.short_doc: True to include rules for rounded corners produced by the slicer. ...

members.name: $include-slicer-gradient
members.doc: True to include rules for background gradients produced by the slicer. Enables emulation of CSS3 background-gradient in browsers that do not support it.
members.short_doc: True to include rules for background gradients produced by the slicer. ...

members.name: $prefix
members.doc: The prefix to be applied to all CSS selectors. If this is changed, it must also be changed in your JavaScript application.
members.short_doc: The prefix to be applied to all CSS selectors. ...

members.name: $relative-image-path-for-uis
members.doc: True to use a relative image path for all new UIs. If true, the path will be "../images/". It can also be a string of the path value. It defaults to false, which means it will look for the images in the ExtJS SDK folder.
members.short_doc: True to use a relative image path for all new UIs. ...

members.name: $theme-resource-path
members.doc: The base path relative to the CSS output directory to use for theme resources. For example if the theme's images live one directory up from the generated CSS output in a directory named 'foo/images/', you would need to set this variable to '../foo/' in order for the image paths in the CSS output to be generated correctly. By default this is the same as the CSS output directory.
members.short_doc: The base path relative to the CSS output directory to use for theme resources. ...

members.name: background-gradient
members.doc:
Creates a background gradient.

Example usage: .foo { @include background-gradient(#808080, matte, left); }

params.name: $type
params.doc:
The type of gradient to be used. Can either be a String which is a predefined gradient name, or it can can be a list of color stops. If null is passed, this mixin will still set the background-color to $bg-color. The available predefined gradient names are:

  • bevel
  • glossy
  • recessed
  • matte
  • matte-reverse
  • panel-header
  • tabbar
  • tab
  • tab-active
  • tab-over
  • tab-disabled
  • grid-header
  • grid-header-over
  • grid-row-over
  • grid-cell-special
  • glossy-button
  • glossy-button-over
  • glossy-button-pressed

Each of these gradient names corresponds to a function named linear-gradient[name]. Themes can override these functions to customize the color stops that they return. For example, to override the glossy-button gradient function add a function named "linear-gradient-glossy-button" to a file named "sass/etc/mixins/background-gradient.scss" in your theme. The function should return the result of calling the Compass linear-gradient function with the desired direction and color-stop information for the gradient. For example:

@function linear-gradient-glossy-button($direction, $bg-color) {
    @return linear-gradient($direction, color_stops(
        mix(#fff, $bg-color, 10%),
        $bg-color 50%,
        mix(#000, $bg-color, 5%) 51%,
        $bg-color
    ));
}

params.name: $direction
params.doc: The direction of the gradient. Can either be top or left.

members.short_doc: Creates a background gradient. ...

members.name: border
members.doc: Creates a border on an element. If any of the parameters is specified as a list, or if any parameter is null, border-style, border-width, and border-color will be specified as separate properties, otherwise all will be collapsed into a single "border" property.
members.short_doc: Creates a border on an element. ...

members.name: color-by-background
members.doc:
Colors the text of an element based on lightness of its background.

.my-element {
  @include color-by-background(#fff); // Colors text black.
}

.my-element {
  @include color-by-background(#fff, 40%); // Colors text gray.
}

params.name: $contrast
params.doc: Contrast of text color to its background.

members.short_doc: Colors the text of an element based on lightness of its background. ...

members.name: css-outline
members.doc: adds a css outline to an element with compatibility for IE8/outline-offset NOTE: the element receiving the outline must be positioned (either relative or absolute) in order for the outline to work in IE8

params.name: $border-width
params.doc: The border-width of the element receiving the outline. Required in order for outline-offset to work in IE8

params.name: $pseudo
params.doc: `true to always use a pseudo element to render the outline. by default this behavior is limited to IE8 only, but can be enabled in all browser when required

members.short_doc:
adds a css outline to an element with compatibility for IE8/outline-offset
NOTE: the element receiving the outline mu...

members.name: font
members.doc: Adds a font specification to an element. Uses a single "font" property if possible, otherwise uses separate font-family, font-size, font-weight and line-height properties.
members.short_doc: Adds a font specification to an element. ...

members.name: google-webfont
members.doc: Includes a google webfont for use in your theme.

params.name: $font-name
params.doc: The name of the font. If the font name contains spaces use "+" instead of space.

params.name: $font-weights
params.doc:
Comma-separated list of font weights to include.

Example usage:

@include google-webfont(
    $font-name: Exo,
    $font-weights: 200 300 400
);

Outputs:

@import url(//fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Exo:200,300,400);

members.short_doc: Includes a google webfont for use in your theme. ...

members.name: margin
members.doc: Creates a margin on an element. If any item in the list is null it will be excluded.
members.short_doc: Creates a margin on an element. ...

members.name: padding
members.doc: Creates a padding on an element. If any item in the list is null it will be excluded.
members.short_doc: Creates a padding on an element. ...
